required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Incidence of Difficult Intubation in Obese Versus Non-obese Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Incidence of Difficult Intubation in Obese Versus Non-obese Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of our study is to identify the incidence of difficult endotracheal intubation in patients with normal BMI undergoing surgery under general anaesthesia in our hospital and compare it to that of obese patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of difficulty in airway management
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of Cormack Lehanne grading (intubation difficulty scale) IDS.

arm_group.description: Patients with a BMI of greater than 30 who are presenting to the hospital for any surgical procedure requiring general anesthesia
Patients with a BMI of less than 30 who are presenting to the hospital for any surgical procedure requiring general anesthesia

intervention.description: Patients with a BMI of greater than 30 or less than who are presenting to the hospital for any surgical procedure requiring general anesthesia

study_pop.textblock: Heterogeneous group representing the general population of Muharraq

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Elective surgery
- BMI< 30 for Normal BMI group
- BMI > 30 for Obese group
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known previous difficult airway
- Pediatric patients.
- Emergency patients
